text:
Same as bug #27

If multiple requests are recieved before a servlet.init has completed multiple instances of the servlet are created with the last servlet created being the 'current' servlet.

The result of this is prior requests to the servlet complete init on their instance of the servlet and then call doGet on the current instance of the servlet which can be uninitialized.
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org

text:
Unfortunately the fix as implemented is still flawed, because the Double 
Checked Locking idiom is subtly flawed in java.

See this reference for details if you need convincing:

http://www.cs.umd.edu/~pugh/java/memoryModel/DoubleCheckedLocking.html
creator: robin@sublime.org
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
In Tomcat 3.3, ServletHandler.init() is now synchronized as recommended in
the DoubleCheckedLocking document.
